trickle.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly in drops or in a thin stream
trickle.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The tears trickled down her cheeks.
trickle.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if people, vehicles, goods etc trickle somewhere, they move there slowly in small groups or amounts
trickle.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The first few fans started to trickle into the stadium.
trickle.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a thin slow flow of liquid
trickle.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The water in the stream had been reduced to a trickle.
trickle.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a movement of people, vehicles, goods etc into a place in very small numbers or amounts
trickle.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Recent legislation has reduced immigration to a trickle.
a trickle of cars on the highway
trickle.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to move somewhere slowly and in very small numbers or amounts
trickle.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Only four or five customers had trickled in by 11:30.
Details of the programs have trickled out over the past weeks, but havenâ€™t been widely publicized.
